Contract worker representing Kelly IT services  
Chipset Validation Technician 
 
·	Used basic hand tools, soldering tools and stereomicroscope. 
·	Used basic electronic test equipment such as millimeters and power supplies. 
·	Used bench-top reflow oven to accomplish reball of BGA devices. 
·	Setup, and used standalone CPV systems to test multiple types of chipset devices. 
·	Performed basic troubleshooting of CPV systems as necessary. 
·	Helped Corporate Quality Network group with their failure analyses in solder joint reliability, which included capturing images and recording data on spreadsheets.

Chipset Validation Technician Intel Corporation May 2009  –  May 2010  (1 year 1 month) Responsible for operating Advantest and Agilent microchip testing equipment as per specific instruction sets from Engineers. Hand testing single units or several thousands using Advantest and Summit ATC handlers.  
Testing required recognizing true failures in chip functions. If illegitimate failures are observed, then trouble shooting is necessary to determine whether these are caused by tester or handler malfunction.  
Efficient usage of available tester time was essential in order to maximize completion of tasks requested within the duration of the work shift. 
Required to maintain updated records of parameters used in tests conducted, noting any deviations from engineers instructions, problems encountered and how they were resolved, time it took to complete the task, and download data to location in data base as per instructions.

Introduced and wrote a procedure to monitor internal cleanliness of E-beam inspection tool to ensure validity of data collected.

Summary Graduated from DeVry University Fremont majoring in Game Simulation and Programming as a programmer specializing in video game development. Skills learned can be brought to all fields of software engineer. Developing video games using industry standard programming language C++ along with cutting-edge technology such as Microsoft DirectX 9 and 11, OpenGL, and FMOD. Major role in development with teams consist of rendering, sound, video, and input framework development as part of the game engine and providing assistance with fellow teammates. 
 
Worked as an IT support assistance in the IT department on campus supporting students, staff, and faculty along with computer labs, projectors, and printers. 
 
Worked at Intel as a contractor through Kelly Services on the graphics team. Supported internal automation system writing and updating scripts utilizing Python and Javascript. Built and maintain automation servers running virtual machines for graphics testing. Worked directly with software engineers to report and regress testing results per build. Built tools and scripts to generate test data results. 
 
Hobbies consist of art illustration and playing guitar to promote creativity. Enjoys developing video games, applicable software, and software designed libraries and APIs on the side for short and long term self-improvement and self-promotion. Summary Currently I've finished my studies in A+ Certification and recently have obtained my A+ license to work on private and corporate desktop computers and laptops. I have extensive experience in optimizing, troubleshooting and managing various home networks and computer systems. I am passionate about computer systems and the technology created for them. My current studies in Network + Certification will expand the foundation created with my A+ certification for the career path that I've chosen for myself. The IT field is one that i'm excited and anxious to become a part of. I do not claim to know everything about technology and computers but I posses the drive and the hunger for knowledge of things unknown to me. 
 
Since I've accomplished my first goal of obtaining my A+ license, the next goal for myself is to finish my studies for my Network + Certification by the end of this year. After I've completed this goal I'll start my training in Cicso technologies specifically networking and set my path towards CCNA (Cisco Certified Network Associate) and eventually set my sights on a CCIE (Cisco Certified Internetwork Expert) Certification. Specialties:Currently, in conjunction with my studies at The Stride Center, I do volunteer work with the Hands On Sacramento organization.
